revised_title: Diurnal Inequalities of Terrestrial Magnetism: Observations at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich (1841-1857)
tldr: This paper presents the diurnal inequalities of terrestrial magnetism observed at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, from 1841 to 1857. The author describes the methods and instruments used for these observations and analyzes the resulting curves, noting significant changes in the magnitude and form of the curves over time. The author suggests a possible explanation for these changes, relating to the magnetic action of the sun on the Earth's northern and southern hemispheres.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Earth's Magnetic Field
